88416.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4eg5j","text":"For a 1% agarose gel, mix the following in a conical flask: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei3l8","text":"  of Agarose powder.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4j1bu","text":"  of 1x TAE buffer (Tris-Acetate-EDTA Buffer).   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4fmvp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5tig","text":"Swirl the agarose solution to mix it well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6cmaj","text":"Heat the agarose solution in a microwave until it boils.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8f1pu","text":"Take out the conical flask from the microwave and swirl the conical flask until the agarose solution is clear and without undissolved agarose powder or lumps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h641","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dii88","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"60ojn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h31c","text":"Wear thermal gloves when handling the hot conical flask from the microwave to prevent burns.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"au8i6","text":"Add   of Ultra GelRed gel stain into the agarose solution and swirl the conical flask until the colour becomes uniform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"75pk4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42et9","text":"Secure a gel tray tightly onto a gel caster and place an 8-well comb or 15-well comb into the tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6iudt","text":"Pour the agarose solution into the tray, ensuring that there are no bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"866m7","text":"Cool down the agarose solution for at least   to get a solidified agarose gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bhq01","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6n1n0","text":"2023 NUS-Singapore iGEM team followed this protocol for gel electrophoresis to isolate the DNA fragments from the PCR products.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"bb2dr","text":"List of DNA Ladder Used by 2023 NUS-Singapore iGEM Team:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31d1d","text":"Quick-Load‱ Purple 1 kb DNA Ladder","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4fjj3","text":"Quick-Load‱ Purple Low Molecular Weight DNA Ladder","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"96EDB1955D0411EE932A0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"96EDB1955D0411EE932A0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e123b","text":"Make an agarose gel by following the steps in the \"Preparation of Agarose Gel\" protocol. Usually, a 1% agarose gel is used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"571ms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22obv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"176d3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":88416,"title":"Preparation of Agarose Gel","title_html":"Preparation of Agarose Gel","load_collapsed":false,"uri":"preparation-of-agarose-gel-c2j8ycrw","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"NUS iGEM","affiliation":"National University of Singapore","affiliation_url":"http://www.nus.edu.sg/","username":"nus-igem","link":"","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nj2e86se.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nj2e86se.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nj2d86se.webp"}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":8},"type_id":1,"guid":"5B4E47D1DDDF409291CED2D2CF7D641A"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21qjf","text":"After the agarose gel has solidified in the gel tray, remove the gel tray from the gel caster and place it in a buffer tank with pre-filled 1x TAE buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fbiqs","text":"Add the correct DNA ladder and the sample(s) into the wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0a5n","text":"Secure the gel tray tightly onto the gel caster.                      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"74tk2","text":"Place an 8-well or 15-well comb into the gel tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"doim7","text":"Close the buffer tank with the tank lid, ensuring that the colour of the electrodes on the tank lid is the same as the one on the buffer tank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3i3i","text":"Run the gel electrophoresis at 110V for 40 minutes, making sure that bubbling occurs when the gel electrophoresis begins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5t8bj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed71j","text":"Upon finishing gel electrophoresis, put the agarose gel onto a UV Sample Tray, next, put it into the Gel Doc EZ System, and then run the gel imaging program on the desktop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Gel Electrophoresis
